questions.question: A 15-foot ladder leans against a vertical wall. The bottom is pulled away from the wall at 2 ft/sec. How fast is the top sliding down when the bottom is 9 feet from the wall?
questions.explanation: Let x = bottom distance from wall, y = height on wall. x² + y² = 225. Given dx/dt = 2, find dy/dt when x = 9. Then y = 12. Differentiate: 2x dx/dt + 2y dy/dt = 0 ⇒ 9(2) + 12 dy/dt = 0 ⇒ dy/dt = −3/2 ft/sec.

questions.question: Air is pumped into a spherical balloon at 10 cm³/s. How fast is the radius increasing when the radius is 5 cm?
questions.explanation: V = (4/3)πr³. dV/dt = 4πr² dr/dt. Set dV/dt = 10, r = 5: 10 = 4π(25) dr/dt ⇒ dr/dt = 10/(100π) = 1/(10π) cm/s.

questions.question: Water flows into an inverted conical tank (height 6 m, top radius 3 m) at 2 m³/min, but leaks out at 0.5 m³/min. How fast is the water level rising when the water depth is 4 m?
questions.explanation: By similar triangles, r/h = 1/2 ⇒ r = h/2. V = (π/12)h³. Net inflow = 2 − 0.5 = 1.5 = dV/dt. Differentiate: dV/dt = (π/4)h² dh/dt. When h = 4: 1.5 = (π/4)(16) dh/dt ⇒ dh/dt = 1.5/(4π) = 3/(8π) m/min.

questions.question: Car A moves north at 60 mph, Car B moves west at 50 mph. Both start from the same intersection at the same time. How fast is the distance between them changing after 3 hours?
questions.explanation: After t hours: distances = 60t and 50t. D = √((60t)² + (50t)²) = 10t√61. dD/dt = 10√61 mph (constant). After 3 hours: 10√61 ≈ 78.1 mph.

questions.question: A 6-ft man walks away from a 20-ft lamppost at 4 ft/sec. How fast is the tip of his shadow moving when he is 30 ft from the post?
questions.explanation: Let x = man's distance from post, y = shadow length. Similar triangles: 20/(x+y) = 6/y ⇒ y = (3/7)x. Tip distance L = x + y = (10/7)x. dL/dt = (10/7) dx/dt = (10/7)×4 = 40/7 ft/sec (constant).

questions.question: A rocket rises vertically at 500 ft/sec. An observer 2000 ft from launch pad tracks it. How fast is the angle of elevation changing when the rocket is 3000 ft high?
questions.explanation: tan θ = y/2000. Differentiate: sec²θ dθ/dt = (1/2000) dy/dt. When y = 3000, tanθ = 1.5, sec²θ = 1 + 2.25 = 3.25. dy/dt = 500 ⇒ 3.25 dθ/dt = 500/2000 = 0.25 ⇒ dθ/dt = 0.25/3.25 = 1/13 rad/sec.

questions.question: A rectangle's length increases at 3 cm/s and width decreases at 2 cm/s. When length = 20 cm and width = 10 cm, how fast is the diagonal changing?
A spherical snowball melts so its surface area decreases at 6 cm²/min. How fast is the radius decreasing when radius = 4 cm?
questions.explanation: S = 4πr². dS/dt = 8πr dr/dt. Given dS/dt = −6, r = 4: −6 = 8π(4) dr/dt = 32π dr/dt ⇒ dr/dt = −6/(32π) = −3/(16π) cm/min.

questions.question: A particle moves along curve y = x² + 3. When x = 2, x increases at 5 units/sec. How fast is y changing?
questions.explanation: dy/dt = 2x dx/dt. At x = 2, dx/dt = 5 ⇒ dy/dt = 2×2×5 = 20 units/sec.

questions.question: Water flows into cylindrical tank (radius 2 m) at 3 m³/min, but drains from a hole at 0.2h m³/min, where h = water depth. When h = 5 m, how fast is water level rising?
questions.explanation: V = π(2)²h = 4πh. dV/dt = 3 − 0.2h = 3 − 0.2×5 = 2 when h=5. Also dV/dt = 4π dh/dt ⇒ 2 = 4π dh/dt ⇒ dh/dt = 1/(2π) m/min.
